India rested Jasprit Bumrah to manage his workload, bringing in Nitish Kumar Reddy, Washington Sundar, and Akash Deep. England retained their winning combination, aiming to build on their previous victory, while India sought to level the series.

title: 'Why do you have doubts?': Amid leadership change buzz, Siddaramaiah says he'll be CM for 5 yrs
description: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has firmly denied any leadership change, asserting his commitment to serving a full five-year term. He dismissed speculations fueled by opposition parties and addressed internal dissent rumors. Deputy CM D K Shivakumar and Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge had also commented on the matter.

title: US defence 'made in China': Is Washington ready for war with Beijing?
description: A report reveals the US defense sector's reliance on China. Chinese firms supply critical components for US defense programs. These programs include missile defense and nuclear systems. The US military supply chains are deeply connected with Beijing's industries. The report highlights US vulnerability due to China's dominance in critical minerals. Experts suggest dissecting critical components instead of complete decoupling.

title: Shubhanshu Shukla set to interact with students and ISRO scientists from space on July 4
description: Indian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla will interact with ISRO students and scientists from the International Space Station. The interaction will occur via ham radio on Friday. This event is part of the ARISS program. It aims to promote STEM education. The session will take place at the U R Rao Satellite Centre in Bengaluru.

title: Dalai Lama successor: India-based Gaden Phodrang Trust to pick next spiritual leader
description: The Dalai Lama has declared that the institution of the Dalai Lama will persist after his death, with the Gaden Phodrang Trust in India holding the authority to recognise his future reincarnation. He emphasised that the selection process should adhere to past Buddhist traditions, involving consultations with Tibetan Buddhist leaders and Dharma Protectors.

title: No more oversight: Iran blocks IAEA from monitoring nulcear programme
Cricket | India tour of Bangladesh could be rescheduled, says BCB official
description: India's scheduled white-ball tour of Bangladesh in August faces a potential postponement due to pending government clearance amidst diplomatic tensions. While cancellation is not an option as the series is part of the ICC's Future Tours Programme, both cricket boards are expected to discuss rescheduling to find mutually convenient dates. The series includes three ODIs and three T20Is.

title: IBPS Hindi Officer recruitment 2025 application window opens: Direct link here
description: The Institute of Banking Personnel Selection (IBPS) has launched the application process for Hindi Officer Grade E Recruitment 2025. The post, based at IBPS Mumbai, includes a selection process involving an online exam, skill test, and interview. Applications are open until July 15, 2025, via www.ibps.in, with the exam tentatively scheduled for July/August.

title: Shefali Jariwala’s demise: Forensic tests continue; exact cause still uncertain- Report
description: The sudden death of actress Shefali Jariwala has sparked an investigation into the cause. A postmortem at Cooper Hospital yielded no immediate answers, prompting further tissue and chemical analysis. Police investigations reveal Shefali fasted before consuming day-old rice and experiencing discomfort. She took medication and received an anti-aging treatment earlier that day.

title: Is Trump dealing with dementia? Psychologist cites ‘telltale’ sign
description: A psychologist, Dr. John Gartner, suggests Donald Trump may be showing early dementia signs, particularly in motor skills. He points to a "telltale" leg swing as potentially indicative of Frontotemporal dementia. Concerns about Trump's gait and mobility have surfaced, contrasting with past athletic abilities, despite a White House physician's report of excellent cognitive and physical health.

title: Sardaarji 3 controversy: Naseeruddin Shah deletes post backing Diljit Dosanjh movie
description: Veteran actor Naseeruddin Shah defended Diljit Dosanjh amidst controversy surrounding 'Sardaar Ji 3' due to the casting of Pakistani actress Hania Aamir. Shah criticized political parties for unfairly targeting Diljit, questioning the selective outrage. After facing backlash, Shah deleted his initial post but shared a cryptic quote about truth.

title: IND v ENG: 'Team's needs more important' - Ex-Eng cricketer on Bumrah's availability
description: Mark Butcher urges India to prioritise winning the Edgbaston Test over managing Jasprit Bumrah's workload, emphasising the importance of leveling the series after England's Headingley victory. Despite Bumrah's desire to play at Lord's, Butcher believes his presence is crucial at Edgbaston. Captain Gill confirms Bumrah's availability, with a decision pending pitch assessment.

title: Who is Anil Menon? Indian-origin Nasa astronaut set for his 1st journey to ISS
How Trump's planned 'economic bunker buster' bill may impact India
description: US Senator Lindsey Graham proposes a 500% tariff on countries still trading with Russia, aiming to cripple Putin's war efforts in Ukraine. The bill targets nations like India and China, major buyers of Russian oil. India, now heavily reliant on Russian oil, faces potential tariffs on its exports to the US, despite ongoing trade agreement negotiations.

title: 2036 Olympics: India officially enter race to host Games, Ahmedabad named host city
description: An Indian delegation officially presented Ahmedabad's bid to host the 2036 Olympic and Paralympic Games. The bid emphasises the opportunity for young Indians to experience the Olympics at home, promoting the principle of global unity. However, the IOC has paused the host selection process for review due to members' concerns about involvement.

title: China can't choose: Dalai Lama plans to reincarnate - will be reborn abroad
description: The Dalai Lama, ahead of his 90th birthday, has declared that the institution of the Dalai Lama will persist after his death, a statement with significant implications for his global Buddhist followers. He emphasised that the Gaden Phodrang Trust, based in India, will have the exclusive authority to identify his successor, adhering to traditional Buddhist practices.

title: IND vs ENG: Former captain asks Gill to be proactive; wants Siraj, Jadeja to step up
description: Ajinkya Rahane has advised Shubman Gill to be more proactive as a captain, especially when defending a total, emphasizing the importance of seeking wickets and setting strategic fields. Rahane also highlighted the need for Mohammed Siraj and Ravindra Jadeja to step up if Jasprit Bumrah is absent.

title: 'Never asked anyone to make me CM': DK Shivakumar amid 'power struggle' with Siddaramaiah
'Very spoilt': Trump warns of 35% tariff as trade deal with Japan falls apart
description: Donald Trump threatened Japan with tariffs of 30-35% if they continue to refuse American rice imports, citing a significant trade deficit. Despite data showing Japan purchased $298 million worth of US rice last year, Trump claimed they "won't take" it. Increased tariff rates may take effect for countries without agreements with Washington after July 9.

title: 'Jinnahwadi party': BJP slams Ajoy Kumar's 'Sikkim a neighbouring country' remark
description: Congress leader Ajoy Kumar triggered controversy by mistakenly referring to Sikkim as a neighboring nation while criticizing the government's foreign policy. The BJP seized on the remark, accusing the Congress of divisive politics and insulting the Northeast. Kumar apologized for the error but questioned the BJP's focus on real issues.

title: Egypt oil ship disaster: Vessel overturns in Gulf of Suez; four dead
description: An oil drilling ship capsized in the Gulf of Suez near Ras Ghareb, Egypt, resulting in at least four fatalities and four missing crew members. Egyptian authorities reported that 22 workers were rescued and hospitalized after the incident, which involved 30 personnel. The Egyptian navy is assisting in the ongoing search for the remaining missing individuals.

title: Parliament security breach: HC grants bail to 2 accused
PM Modi on 5-nation tour: Ghana, Brazil & more on itinerary; Brics, trade in focus
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi embarked on a five-nation tour from July 2-9, visiting Ghana, Trinidad & Tobago, Argentina, Brazil, and Namibia. The trip aims to strengthen India's ties with the Global South, focusing on enhanced cooperation in various sectors like investment, energy, and technology. Modi will engage with leaders and address parliaments, reaffirming India's commitment to multilateral platforms and partnerships.

title: Covid-19 vaccines safe, no link to sudden deaths: Centre
Gold price prediction today: Where is gold rate headed in the near future?
description: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are expected to remain volatile due to evolving global economic conditions. Recent corrective moves followed easing geopolitical tensions and trade policy progress. Mixed economic data from the US, Euro area, UK, Japan, and India influenced market sentiment.

title: Indian teen author and scientist writes motivational biography on Elon Musk
description: Indian teen author and scientist, Vivaan Karulkar, has released his third book, "Elon Musk: The Man Who Bends Reality." The 18-year-old, already known for his books on Sanatan Dharam and a patent on detecting Near Earth Objects, has been following Musk for a decade.

title: 'Outrageous': Lawyer sips beer during virtual hearing; Gujarat HC begins contempt proceedings
description: The Gujarat High Court initiated contempt proceedings against senior counsel Bhaskar Tanna after a video surfaced showing him drinking from a beer mug and talking on the phone during a virtual hearing. The court deemed Tanna's behavior "outrageous and glaring," emphasizing the potential damage to the rule of law if such actions are ignored.

title: Indian charged in Singapore: Seafarer Soosai Antony Vainer held for ship collision - 'acted without orders'
description: Soosai Antony Vainer, an Indian national, faces charges in Singapore for a fatal ship collision last year. As the duty lookout on the Hafnia Nile, Vainer allegedly failed to report the approaching Ceres I to his superior, Wickramage Viraj Amila Shavinda Perera. Instead, he steered the ship independently, leading to the collision that killed one and injured another.

title: Congress 'unity show' flatlines? DK Shivakumar backs Siddaramaiah; cites 'no option'
description: Tensions within the Karnataka Congress resurfaced as DK Shivakumar reluctantly pledged support to Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, despite earlier leadership change expectations. This development follows assurances from the party high command that Siddaramaiah will complete his full term, dismissing speculations of internal rifts and leadership shifts. The party is trying to project a united front amidst ongoing speculation.

title: Mumbai horror: Woman abandons 15-day-old baby on local train; search for mother under way
description: In Navi Mumbai, a woman abandoned her 15-day-old infant on a local train, entrusting the baby to fellow passengers before disembarking at Khandeshwar station. The incident occurred on the Harbour line, prompting police to initiate a search and file charges under Section 93 of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita.

title: Dalai Lama reveals succession plan:  How will the next Buddhist spiritual leader be selected? - All you need to know
description: As the Dalai Lama turned 90, he clarified that his reincarnation will occur, with his institution leading the selection, guided by Tibetan Buddhist traditions. He suggested his successor could be from the diaspora and might not be male. China, however, insists that the selection requires their approval, following a traditional process within China.

title: 'Biggest reforms? Not at all': Chidambaram counters Amit Shah on new criminal laws; calls their enactment an exercise in 'cut and paste'
description: Senior Congress leader P. Chidambaram has criticized the new criminal laws, labeling them a mere "cut and paste" exercise, countering Home Minister Amit Shah's claim of them being the biggest reforms since Independence. Chidambaram asserts that the new laws largely replicate the old ones, causing confusion among legal professionals.

title: Uttarakhand CM Dhami welcomes newly elected BJP state president Mahendra Bhatt
description: Chief Minister Dhami congratulated Bhatt and extended best wishes for his second term as the state BJP chief. State General Secretary (Organisation) Ajaey Kumar was also present on the occasion.

title: China vs Dalai Lama: Beijing says govt to approve successor; claims name to come from golden urn
description: China insists on approving the next Dalai Lama. However, the current Dalai Lama says the selection should follow Tibetan Buddhist traditions. He reiterated this ahead of his 90th birthday. The Dalai Lama has entrusted the Gaden Phodrang Trust with overseeing the search. The current Dalai Lama fled to India in 1959.

title: #Unstoppable 21: ‘They’re setting the pace for the Bharat to come’
description: The Times of India's #Unstoppable21 recognized 21 young talents in India across science, sports, and music, chosen from numerous nominations by an eminent jury. Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia lauded the GenZ winners, emphasizing their role in shaping the future of India.

'Jinnahwadi party': BJP slams Ajoy Kumar's 'Sikkim a neighbouring country' remark; Congress leader hits back

The BJP seized on the remark, accusing the Congress of divisive politics and insulting the Northeast. Kumar apologized for the error but questioned the BJP's focus on real issues.

description: The Dalai Lama has declared that the institution of the Dalai Lama will persist after his death, with the Gaden Phodrang Trust in India holding the authority to recognise his future reincarnation. He emphasised that the selection process should adhere to past Buddhist traditions, involving consultations with Tibetan Buddhist leaders and Dharma Protectors.

title: 97,000 criminals convicted in UP under CM Yogi's 'Operation Conviction'
description: Uttar Pradesh's law and order landscape has undergone a transformation under chief minister Yogi Adityanath's zero-tolerance policy. Moving beyond arrests, the state police--working under his direct supervision--are now focused on securing swift convictions through fast-track prosecution. Launched on July 1, 2023, Operation Conviction has proven to be a game-changer in this regard, leading to the conviction of 97,158 criminals between July 2023 and mid-June 2025, the Chief Minister's office said in a press release.

title: Himachal havoc: 10 dead, 34 feared missing as rain batters several parts of state; relief efforts on
description: Himachal Pradesh is grappling with severe monsoon-related disasters as ten people have died and 34 are missing due to cloudbursts and flash floods in Mandi district. The region has become the 'epicentre' of the disaster, with widespread devastation reported in Thunag, Karsog, and Gohar subdivisions. NDRF and SDRF teams are conducting relief operations, providing emergency shelter and essential supplies to affected residents.

title: #Unstoppable21: Meet the winners
description: TOI again celebrates youngsters from across India who’ve made a mark and are hungry for more

title: 'Parties should appoint more booth agents': ECI sources on Bihar electoral roll revision; 'They should not complain later'
description: The Election Commission of India is encouraging political parties to increase the number of booth level agents for Bihar's special intensive revision process, emphasizing that parties should act now rather than complain later. While many BLAs are already engaged, the ECI indicates there is still time for parties to appoint additional BLAs.

Covid-19 vaccines safe; no evidence linking shots to sudden deaths: ICMR, NCDC studies

REVEALED! Which Test will Bumrah play? Gill finally answers
description: India's pace bowler Jasprit Bumrah is set to rejoin the team for the third Test against England. The match will be held at Lord's next week. Shubman Gill confirmed Bumrah's return. Bumrah was rested for the second Test as part of workload management. Three changes were made to the team for the second Test.

title: 'Daftest decision' - Social media goes bezerk after Bumrah, Kuldeep, Sai absences
description: India made significant changes for the second Test against England, dropping Sai Sudharsan after his underwhelming debut and surprisingly excluding Kuldeep Yadav. Jasprit Bumrah is rested for workload management, leading to Akash Deep's inclusion alongside Washington Sundar and Nitish Kumar Reddy.

title: Who was Larkins? India, England wear black armbands in tribute
description: England and India players wore black armbands in the second Test at Edgbaston to honor Wayne Larkins, the former England cricketer who recently passed away. Larkins, who played 13 Tests and 25 ODIs, was remembered for his elegant strokeplay and impactful performances, including a memorable winning innings against the West Indies.

title: 'Team's needs more important' - Ex-Eng cricketer on Bumrah's availability
description: Mark Butcher urges India to prioritise winning the Edgbaston Test over managing Jasprit Bumrah's workload, emphasising the importance of leveling the series after England's Headingley victory. Despite Bumrah's desire to play at Lord's, Butcher believes his presence is crucial at Edgbaston. Captain Gill confirms Bumrah's availability, with a decision pending pitch assessment.

title: India Playing XI tip-off: Nitish Reddy, Washington Sundar likely to play
description: India are likely to include all-rounders Nitish Kumar Reddy and Washington Sundar in the Edgbaston Test, potentially at the expense of a specialist batter. Assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate hinted at Reddy's inclusion, while captain Shubman Gill emphasized the need for batting depth and the inclusion of two spinners given the dry conditions in Birmingham.

title: IND vs ENG: India may adopt safety-first approach as second Test begins today
description: Ahead of the crucial second Test against England, Team India grapples with team composition uncertainties. Coach Gautam Gambhir and captain Shubman Gill engaged in intense discussions, focusing on the bowling attack. Jasprit Bumrah's likely absence and the choice between Washington Sundar and Kuldeep Yadav add to the dilemma.

title: Asia Cup: India vs Pak likely on Sept 7; tournament starts Sept 5 in UAE
description: The Asia Cup 2025 is tentatively scheduled to commence on September 5, culminating in the final on September 21. According to the initial schedule, India is poised to face off against Pakistan on September 7. With participating nations nearing government clearances, the tournament is likely to be held in the UAE.

title: Pakistan cricket: What’s the point? Ex-cricketer rips PCB apart
description: Former Pakistan cricketer Kamran Akmal has strongly criticized the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) for appointing Azhar Mahmood as the interim Test team coach. Akmal questioned the logic behind this decision, drawing parallels to Mickey Arthur's controversial role.

title: 'Going for wickets is a lie': Ashwin urges India to contain England's Bazball
description: Ravichandran Ashwin has advised the Indian bowlers to prioritise building pressure over aggressively seeking wickets in the upcoming Test against England. He anticipates England will cautiously play Jasprit Bumrah and then aggressively target the other bowlers with their 'Bazball' approach. Ashwin suggests India adopt a more defensive and containment-focused strategy to counter England's aggressive batting style.

title: Sammy breaks silence on sexual assault allegations against Windies player
description: West Indies head coach Daren Sammy addressed sexual assault allegations against a player, emphasising the need for justice and adherence to legal procedures. He highlighted his support for players' mental well-being and the importance of due process. Sammy acknowledged the allegations reported by the media but stressed the justice system's process, while CWI stated they haven't received official communication.

title: IND vs ENG Test: Ben Stokes can't stop gushing over Rishabh Pant's strokeplay
description: England captain Ben Stokes expressed his admiration for Rishabh Pant's audacious batting style, recalling Pant's impactful Edgbaston innings in 2022. Stokes acknowledged the scrutiny Pant faces but lauded his ability to unleash his talent. Moeen Ali and Andrew Flintoff visited the English practice sessions, offering guidance to Shoaib Bashir and Jofra Archer, respectively.

title: 2nd T20I: Jemimah, Amanjot star in India's 24-run win vs England
description: Jemimah Rodrigues and Amanjot Kaur's explosive half-centuries propelled India to a 24-run victory over England in the second T20I, securing a 2-0 series lead. Their crucial 93-run partnership revived India after an early collapse, setting up a formidable total of 181. Despite Beaumont and Ecclestone's efforts, England fell short, with Shree Charani's impressive bowling further sealing India's win.

title: IND vs ENG Test match: What time will England vs India 2nd Test start? What are the session timings?
description: India face a tough decision on playing Jasprit Bumrah in the upcoming Edgbaston Test against England, balancing his workload concerns with the need to level the series after a five-wicket loss at Headingley. Assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate indicated a late call on Bumrah's inclusion. It was re-emphasised by captain Shubman Gill.

title: Controversial West African activist Kemi Seba detained in Paris
description: Kemi Seba, a controversial African activist known for his virulent anti-Western stance, has been arrested in Paris, a source close to the case told AFP Tuesday.

title: France’s new health pass rules raise questions as many scramble to adapt
description: While the extension of France’s health pass and other new anti-Covid 19 measures announced by President Emmanuel Macron Monday night are yet to be hammered out in detail, what’s certain is that a full-throttled return to a normal life of frequenting café terraces, restaurants, cinemas, theatres and other culture and leisure activities will now hinge on having a pass sanitaire (or health pass).

title: Daughter loses legal case in bitter Asterix family feud
description: A long-running family feud between Asterix co-creator Albert Uderzo and his daughter took a new twist on Tuesday after judges dismissed a claim by Sylvie Uderzo that her father was mentally frail and being exploited.

title: Sarkozy’s legal woes roll on despite court ruling
description: A probe into claims Nicolas Sarkozy received illegal funding for his successful 2007 presidential campaign has been dropped. But as he considers a political comeback, several other cases threaten serious damage to his reputation.

title: African troops march with French for Bastille Day
description: The famed military parade for Bastille Day on Paris’s Champs-Elysées Sunday featured African troops who assisted France in its Mali operation against Islamist rebels. However, some have criticised the African presence as a sign of neo-colonial ties.

title: French conservatives defeat far right in tight by-election
description: France’s conservative UMP party narrowly defeated the far-right National Front in a by-election on Sunday, with candidate Jean-Louis Costes (pictured) winning the seat vacated by disgraced Socialist MP Jérôme Cahuzac following a tax evasion scandal.

title: Record number of women and minorities in new French parliament
description: With more women and members of foreign descent than any previous National Assembly, France's newly-elected parliament has moved a step closer to mirroring French society, even as ethnic-minority groups demand more diversity in politics.

title: New poll gives Sarkozy first round election lead
description: An opinion poll for the first time Tuesday put French President Nicolas Sarkozy ahead of Socialist rival François Hollande for the April 22 first round of presidential elections but showed Hollande would win a run-off vote on May 6.

title: Socialist candidate drums up support in French tropics
description: Socialist presidential hopeful Francois Hollande and President Nicolas Sarkozy will both visit French overseas regions Martinique, Guadeloupe, and French Guiana in upcoming weeks, with Hollande kicking off the charm offensive first.

title: Violent protests have ‘weakened unions’ in retirement battle
description: As the French government gets closer to signing a law that will raise the retirement age in France from 60 to 62, a leading French labour expert says violent clashes between youths and police have undermined the unions’ position.

title: Left-wing alliance trumps Sarkozy’s party in regional polls
description: The ruling UMP party of President Nicolas Sarkozy experienced a wipeout in the second round of France’s regional elections, with the Socialists and their left-wing allies winning in all but one of mainland France's 22 regions.

title: France bans smoking in beaches, parks and bus shelters from Sunday
description: A ban on smoking in certain public spaces including beaches, parks, bus shelters and public gardens comes into effect in France from Sunday, the government said.

title: Top contemporary French artist Christian Boltanski dies aged 76
description: Christian Boltanski, one of France's top contemporary artists whose multimedia works probed the meaning of mortality and memory, has died aged 76, a former museum director told AFP on Sunday.

title: ‘France is your homeland’, Hollande tells French Jews
description: French President François Hollande announced tough new measures to combat anti-Semitism on Tuesday as he marked the 70th anniversary of the liberation of the Auschwitz death camp with a visit to Paris's Holocaust memorial.

title: World leaders arrive in France for D-Day celebrations
description: Seventy years after the first Allied planes set off for the World War II invasion of Normandy, world leaders descended on France Thursday to remember the dead and commemorate D-Day in two days of memorial celebrations.

title: French court drops probe into Sarkozy campaign cash
description: A French court on Monday dropped a formal investigation into illegal campaign financing by former president Nicolas Sarkozy, who had been under investigation since March for allegedly accepting funds from L'Oréal heiress Liliane Bettencourt.

title: US consultant admits role in France's 'Karachi affair'
description: A US political consultant has admitted being paid by an intermediary in 1994 arms sales for advising the campaign of French presidential hopeful Édouard Balladur. The admission may shed new light on the scandal known as the “Karachi affair”.

title: French far-right shames Socialists in by-election
description: The far-right National Front has moved on to the second round of a parliamentary by-election to replace disgraced former MP Jérôme Cahuzac. The victory is an embarrassing blow to the Socialist government of President François Hollande.

title: Greens secure ‘historic’ gains in French parliamentary poll
description: France’s Green party won 17 seats in the country’s general election Sunday, an unprecedented score that makes it prominent enough to form its own parliamentary group, giving it more clout in political decision-making.

title: 'Lust’ is not a crime, say Strauss-Kahn lawyers
description: Dominique Strauss-Kahn’s lawyers have said their client, placed under formal investigation Monday for alleged involvement in a prostitution ring, was being hounded for “the offence of lust” which is “not forbidden in the penal code”.

title: Who will be France’s next first lady, or gentleman?
description: A singer, a journalist, a housewife or a plasterer’s son: who will move into the Elysée Palace in May, and can candidates count on their partners to help them get there? FRANCE 24 takes a look at who might be France’s next first lady… or gentleman.

title: Who's on strike in France?
description: Numerous industry sectors have joined the growing strikes against French President Nicolas Sarkozy’s unpopular pension reforms. Here are the sectors causing the most disruption.

title: Roma expulsion orders called into question by lawyers
description: In the Parisian suburb of Montreuil, 14 Roma men were ordered to leave French territory after a police roundup in August. Lawyers say their case proves the government is behind a discriminatory and illegal policy of expulsions.

title: Left-leaning parties form alliance to keep lead in second round
description: Ahead of a March 21 run-off vote, France’s Socialists allied with the Greens and other left leaning parties in a deal struck on Tuesday following the Socialists’ first-place showing in round one of regional elections.

title: France steps closer to adding consent to legal definition of rape
description: The French Senate has passed a bill that would change the legal definition of rape to add a clear reference to consent, bringing the country in line with several European neighbours. A joint committee of senators and lower-house MPs is now expected to draft a joint text prior to its final adoption.

title: In search for French heroes, Macron blunders – again
description: France’s embattled leader saw a week of World War I commemorations as a chance to reconnect with the French and highlight the danger of nationalism. Instead, his comments about Marshal Pétain gave further evidence of his tendency to shock and dismay.

title: France makes 323 arrests since start of Euro 2016 championship
description: French police have made 323 arrests since the start of the European Championships, the interior ministry said on Thursday, as Europe's showcase football event continues to be marred by violence.

title: Sarkozy ensnared in Bettencourt scandal
description: Former president Nicolas Sarkozy will remain under formal investigation in a case involving suspected illegal campaign donations by France’s richest woman, Liliane Bettencourt, after judges dismissed a motion to throw out a key medical report.

title: French ministers disclose personal wealth for first time
description: French authorities published the personal wealth of ministers on the government website on Monday in a bid to restore public confidence following a tax-evasion scandal which led to the resignation of former budget minister Jérôme Cahuzac.

title: Socialists free to push through reform agenda
description: The resounding Socialist Party victory in Sunday's parliamentary elections will allow new French President François Hollande to follow through with promised economic reforms to stimulate growth across Europe, a senior minister said Monday.
